text: hello everyone today I want to explore a
new feature of AWS private certificate
Authority or AWS private CA called the
connector for active directory this
connector can help you more easily
provision certificates for users and
machines within your Microsoft active
directory or ad environment adbs private
CA can accelerate your provisioning and
reduce the need for Hardware security
module or HSM management and other timec
consuming operational
tasks today many ad administrators
provision users and machines with
certificate based authentication with
active directory certificate services or
adcs however doing so requires admins to
build their own certificate Authority or
CA infrastructure often including hsms
to store private keys they also must
manage key ceremonies key generation
compliance requirements and other
elements of the
process AWS private CA aims to simplify
that whole process for you with this
highly available and fully managed
service you can issue private
certificates to establish endpoints for
TLS encryption cryptographically signed
code authenticate users and more and now
you can use the connector for ad to
issue certificates to domain join
devices in your ad
environment note that this feature is
distinct from the active directory
connector which is a directory Gateway
you can use to redirect directory
requests to your on- premise Microsoft
ad without caching any information in
the
cloud you can create a connector for ad
in the ads Management console allowing
you to seamlessly integrate ABS private
CA with ad and issue certificates from
adbs private CA using the same Auto
enrollment and Group Policy based
methods you use
today you can use adbs private CA to
create a connector for active directory
configure the certificate templates
required for your specific use cases and
automatically issue certificates using
the ad Auto enrollment mechanisms you
already use with
adcs you can use connector for ad to
integrate with your on premises ad
environment using the active directory
connector or with adbs managed Microsoft
ad you no longer need to configure and
manage a Windows CA or hsms to protect
your ca private Keys as the ca private
keys and adbs private CA are stored in
fips 140-2 validated
hsms this allows admins to focus on
other tasks rather than management of
Casas and
hsms more importantly your admins will
not need to change the way they issue
certificates to end user devices which
reduces the effort needed to migrate
away from your existing on premise pki
the connector for ad exposes an endpoint
to integrate with ads manag Microsoft ad
or your self-managed ad the connector
for ad acts as a broker for certificate
requests between AD and ads private CA
enabling the auto enrollment of
certificates for users and systems
managed by
ad the connector for ad can be used to
issue certificates to domain join
devices for both on premise ad
environments using the active directory
conector provided by adbs directory
services and AD environments hosted in
ads manag Microsoft
ad using ads private CA and the
connector for ad can help you decrease
pki costs offload Hardware management
and compliance requirements to AWS and
reduce the time your administrators
spend on operational tasks that could be
better used for delivering value to your
business let's take a look at this
request flow diagram this is an example
architecture using adbs manag Microsoft
ad and a connector for ad to issue
certificates to domain join devices from
adbs private CA first ads manag
Microsoft ad provides the device an
updated Group Policy object with auto
enrollment details the device will then
request certificate template info from
the connector for ad the connector
authenticates this request with your ads
manage Microsoft
ad now in step four of the diagram the
domain join device can receive
information about enabled certificate
templates and send a certificate signing
request or CSR to ABS private CA via the
connector for
ad adbs private CA can then issue the
certificate and distribute it to the
domain join device using the connector
for
ad this process is similar when using
the ad connector to extend your on-
premise ad environment to
adbs next I'll walk through the process
of creating a connector for ad and
enabling certificate templates I've
chosen to use ABS manage Microsoft ad
for this demo but you can find Specific
Instructions for environments that
utilize the ad connector in the adbs
private CA document
ation to get started with the connector
for ad there are a few prerequisites you
will need to use AWS private CA to
create a CA to issue certificates or use
an existing CA if you've already created
one you will also need to create or
identify an existing directory using
adbs directory
service for this demo I've pre-created a
directory using ads manage Microsoft
ad you will also need an i IM principle
with an identity based policy with
permissions to create and configure the
connector
use the QR code on the screen to view
the adbs private CA documentation with
more information on the required
permissions lastly you will need a
security group with their appropriate
rules to allow DNS keros and ldap more
information on the security group
configuration is detailed in the adbs
private CA documentation linked by the
QR
code okay now that I'm in the adbs
Management console let's navigate to the
AWS private CA
service on the left panel I will choose
connector for active
directory in the active directory
section I will select the active
directory type as ads manage Microsoft
ad now I will choose the directory I
pre-created from the select your
directory
dropdown next I'll select the security
group for the VPC endpoint that I
configured with the appropriate
rules in the private certificate
Authority Section I will choose the caii
pre recreated to issue the private
certificates I can optionally add tags
but I'll skip this for
now finally I'll choose create
connector this process may take a few
minutes now I've created a connector fre
ad that will enable you to issue
certificates for domain joined devices
from adbs private
CA you will also need to configure the
appropriate certificate templates for
use in your organization based on your
specific use cases I'll demonstrate the
configuration of templates
now I will choose create
template for this demo I will choose to
start with a predefined template
workstation
authentication now I need to configure
some settings for the template I want to
create including name schema version and
client
compatibility next I will Define
settings for the certificates that will
be issued based on the this template
review the ads private CA documentation
for more details on each of these
settings I also need to configure the
request handling and enrollment settings
as well as the settings for key usage
extensions and cryptography note that
these settings may vary depending on
your use case and my selections are only
for demonstration purposes you should
configure these according to your own
requirements I will configure the
permissions for enrollment using the
configure groups and permissions
section
lastly I can choose to configure
superseding templates and tags for the
ad resource I will skip this for the
purposes of this
demo now I will click create
template and that's it I've created a
connector for ad and created a new
template for issuing certificates please
use the QR code on screen to review the
getting started guide for more details
and a step-by-step guide to create and
configure a connector you can also find
the link to to the getting started guide
in the description of this
video in this video I introduced the new
ads private CA feature connector for ad
and discussed how it can help you
simplify pki management reducing both
operational intricacies and costs to
learn more about the services mentioned
in the video refer to the ads private CA
and ads directory Services documentation
Pages you can get started creating Casas
in ads private CA using the ads
Management console ad a CLI or
apis
